title: ISic000190. Funerary plaque for Lesbius and Damophilus
body:
1[---]P̣(ubli) · l(iberto) · Lesbi[o]
2[---]ḷ(iberto) · Damopḥ[ilo]
3[---]ṭas · f(ecit) · d(e) · s(uo)

1[---].·L·LESBI[.]
2[---].·DAMOP.[...]
3[---].AS·F·D·S

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text based on autopsy

English translation

Alex Antoniou

[...] To [...] Lesbius, freedman of Publius [..., and ...] Damophilus, freedman of [..., ?] made [this] from his own resources.

commentary

It is clear that lines 1-2 address the dedicatees, both freedmen, but that line 3 would have included the name of the dedicant. The cognomen Lesbius, of Greek origin, is common. The cognomen Damophilus, also of Greek origin, is less common but nonetheless elsewhere attested in the empire.

bibliography

  • 112 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
  • VIII 706 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002649
  • Salinas NSA 1886 337 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001392
